item.title: Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O Available on Steam, New Launch Trailer Released
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/virtua-fighter-5-r-e-v-o-available-on-steam-new-launch-trailer-released/

Today, the iconic Virtua Fighter makes a return, with Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O now being available on Steam. The game also has a 20% discount on Steam right now to celebrate the release of the title. Shortly after this game was announced, a new Virtua Fighter was also announced.  For Virtua Fighter, this is the first time it's come to PC and it makes it pretty groundbreaking for those who have been eager to play it on PC and have never had the opportunity to do so until now. If you want to buy the standard edition of the game, you can get it for $15.99 on Steam right now.

Along with the release of the game comes the official launch trailer, which you can watch below.

Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O is based on Virtua Fighter 5 Ultimate Showdown and will feature rollback netcode and new balance adjustments to the game for the first time in over 13 years. This is to provide a smoother experience for those who want to get stuck into the fighting action. Additionally, the game now has support of up to 60fps/4k resolution, so players get the highest fidelity while working to become the best fighter in the world.

For those who want a premium experience, you can also purchase the 30th Anniversary Edition for Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O on Steam, which also has a 20% discount right now. It includes the following items:

  • 30th Anniversary Soundtrack Collection, including more than 200 unreleased tracks
  • Exclusive Artbook containing sketches and art from the original game's pre-production
  • 30th Anniversary Swimsuit Costume Set with beachwear for all characters
  • DLC Legendary Pack, including customization items, stages, character models and background music from the original Virtua Fighter
  • Yakuza Series Collaboration Pack with character costumes, background music, and stamps from the Yakuza series
  • 30th Anniversary in-game Rank Titles
  • 30th Anniversary Wallpaper set

In addition to the release of Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O on PC, it was announced during the most recent VF Direct that fans of the franchise will also get to look forward to the Virtua Fighter Open Championship, which is a global tournament that utilizes the steam version of the game. While it doesn't have a specific date yet, it's set to be held during spring this year. Those who win the regional qualifiers will go on to face off at the Grand Final Tournament. There isn't more information on this just yet, but more details about this particular competition will be released soon.

Will you be picking up Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O?

item.title: Dying Light The Beast Confirmed for This Summer as Franchise Celebrates 10th Anniversary with New Roadmap
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/dying-light-the-beast-confirmed-for-this-summer-as-franchise-celebrates-10th-anniversary-with-new-roadmap/

Today, Techland shared many announcements as part of its celebrations for the tenth anniversary of the Dying Light franchise. Firstly, the numbers: over 45 million users have played either the first or the second game in the first-person open-world zombie series that originally debuted in 2015, an increase of 15 million since the previous announcement from two years ago. During this decade, they have racked up 67 billion zombie kills and over 1 billion hours of total playtime.

To commemorate the tenth anniversary, the first and second games will feature a series of events over four weeks. In the first week, Dying Light will get HyperMode with a double XP bonus, while the sequel will enjoy the biggest discount ever (up to 67%, depending on the platform and region). In the following weeks, the original game will be refreshed with the Low Gravity, Super-Crane, and Viral Rush events, while Dying Light 2 players will be able to take advantage of new bounties via the Pilgrim Outpost website. In the fourth week, the sequel is also finally receiving the Tower Raid cooperative roguelike mode as a permanent addition to the game, following several playtest rounds.

That's just the tip of the iceberg revealed today for the franchise. The first Dying Light will soon receive a new patch that improves visuals and adds a remastered soundtrack with new music from the original composer Paweł Błaszczak. Of course, most of the content is coming to Dying Light 2 Stay Human, which is roughly in the middle of its promised five-year post-launch support. The updated roadmap for 2025 shows co-op gameplay and matchmaking improvements, new playable Tower Raid characters, improved Community Maps support, new firearms and melee weapons, an entirely new weapon class, improvements to the Prologue, graphical and technical improvements, and, of course, free gear and outfits.

That's still not everything Techland talked about today. The Polish developer confirmed they've got Dying Light: The Beast, which will mark the return of original game protagonist Kyle Crane, slated for the Summer season. Moreover, there are some unannounced Dying Light projects in the works, as well as new board games, exclusive merchandise, and an original webcomic series.

item.title: New Split Fiction Trailer Showcases Co-Op Gameplay and Side Stories
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/new-split-fiction-trailer-showcases-co-op-gameplay-and-side-stories/

Today, Hazelight released a new trailer for Split Fiction, a title that was announced at The Game Awards. This is the new game coming from the ambitious studio that made It Takes Two. This game is set to push the boundaries of a co-op adventure, where players can jump between sci-fi and fantasy worlds while exploring their own side stories in a journey of discovery. If you want to see the new trailer for Split Fiction, you can find it down below.

As you get glimpses into the story, Josef Fares, the founder of Hazelight walks you through the co-op scenarios that you can participate in and the varying gameplay that you'll get to experience. In addition to the co-op gameplay that you'll get to see in Split Fiction, the trailer also talks about a special feature called Side Stories. These are one-off adventures that you can do that are hidden throughout the main story levels, providing a shake-up to the mechanics and allowing you to learn more about the personalities and stories of Mio and Zoe.

As explained in a blog post on the EA website, Side Stories happen as a result of Mio and Zoe being stuck in the same simulation. The portals that appear are attempts to steal Mio and Zoe's unfinished stories from when they were younger. As a result, this leads to a lot of wacky situations that they will get to traverse together. These include riding Sandfish across a desert and performing tricks while under heavy fire. Others include becoming pigs and finding out how sausages are made. With these Side Stories, it's set to provide a lot of laughs and questionable moments as you get to explore the game.

Much like A Way Out and It Takes Two, Hazelight Studios' has promised that the Friend's Pass will be back for Split Fiction, too. This means that one player who owns the game can invite a friend to play the game for free. In addition, Hazelight also has plans to add crossplay, allowing friends to play across PlayStation, Xbox, and PC.

Split Fiction is set to release on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on March 6, 2025. The game will be priced at $49.99.

Will you be playing Split Fiction when it releases? Let us know in the comments.
